sub_title: Contracts Advisor at Saudi Arabian Oil Company
summary:
SUMMARY
Certified (DCCM) Contracts Administrator/Specialist with strong analytical skills, work experience in both procurement, finance and in-depth knowledge in SAP procurement modules. Customer focused, who thrives on the challenges in providing high quality service to stakeholders. One who has a can-do approach, a creative mind-set with excellent interpersonal skills. Dependable self-motivated team player, who is accustomed to working methodically and accurately to deadlines. 


KEY SKILLS

DCCM (Duke University Certified Contract Management Professional), experienced in aspects of contract procurement for both service & project contracts; Pre-Award, Award and Post-Award procedures and processes.

Team Leadership by influencing, sharing knowledge and demonstrating best practice to others.

Strong stakeholder management, organisational skills and communicates effectively through a range of media (verbal, visual and written).

Solid Finance Management Information/Controlling skills, encompassing data analysis and interpretation, demonstrating root cause analysis and the application of standard solutions to diagnosed problems.

In-depth knowledge of SAP contracting and finance modules.

Firm knowledge of business finance practices, accounting disciplines, policies and standards

profile_positions.description:
Duties and Responsibilities: Developed Long-Form Contracts on behalf of Saudi Aramco’s Community Services Department. Coordinated activities and provided technical expertise to assure the proper and timely development and/or maintenance and administration of contracts and amendments, maintained conformity to the accepted corporate contracting policies and procedures, and met operational requirements in a timely and cost-effective manner. 
 
•	Developed and processed service/project contracts and amendments simultaneously with values up to $250 million.  
•	Provided professional level of analyses of the scope of work for various contract services, that included the company risk or exposure.
•	Drafted Solicitation of Interest, Request for Proposal and Bid Review Program documents.
•	Obtained approvals from Finance and Law Departments to the issuance of service and project Pro-forma contracts before tendering.
•	Written presentation papers for the tender committee of Senior Vice Presidents, in order to approve the awards of high value contracts ($50 million and above). 
•	Provided professional analysis of technical evaluations, commercial bid analysis, negotiations of offers and preparation of counter offers.  
•	Met with contractors including leading Kick-Off meetings, regarding their performance of execution of their contracts and ensuring they meet the terms and conditions of their contracts. 
•	Coordinated and participated in the preparation of responses to contractor claims and represents the operation on Claim Review Panels. 
•	Verified work completed by contractors and initiated payments of contractor's invoices. 
•	Amended, extended or closed out service and project contracts. 
•	Team Lead of Contracts Advisors that developed and awarded high value service contracts for various remote camps in the Eastern Province of Saudi Arabia.
profile_positions.title: Contracts Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Contract Procurement
•As part of the procurement process, generate financial pre-qualification evaluations using the annual accounts (Balance Sheets, Profit & Loss and Cash-flows Accounts etc...) of bidders for contracts. This is to determine whether bidders for AOC contracts are financially sound.
•Conducting Financial Reviews on proposed new procurement contracts for both AOC and the parent company, Saudi Aramco. Financial Reviews help ensure the Scope of Work is clear, risk management, pricing structure, tax and accounting issues are properly addressed, before Pro-forma contracts are sent for Request for Quotations to interested bidders. Types of contracts reviewed range from cutting-edge technologies, manpower for Joint Venture Projects to Saudi Aramco strategic studies and maintenance at Saudi refineries. During 2013, performed Financial Reviews on 43 procurement contracts with a combined value of $120m.
•Member of the Bid Review Teams, analysing, negotiating, selecting winning commercial bidsl. The aim is to obtain the best prices and terms and conditions for Aramco.
Compliance & Auditing 
•Document accepted procedures for controlling and reporting on business compliance. To help ensure that administration of AOC contracts comply with established AOC processes by promoting/advising best practices. For management purposes, continuous Compliance Reviews are conducted, in order to assess business compliance & risk management levels. 
•Conduct external compliance audits on contractors, regarding their obligations and performance pertaining to their contracts with AOC. This is done by developing the scope for the audit, establishing a team and time frame, gathering input from the contractor(s), issuing reports of the findings and making recommendations to Management. Last Audit: Logistics contract that facilitates & controls the movement of AOC Materials through three warehouse locations within Europe. The value of Logistics Contract is $100m.
profile_positions.title: Financial Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Budgeting & Management Information (MI) Reporting
•	Held regular engagement sessions with senior leaders & their budget-holding managers of corporate departments (annual budgeting totals were $240m). With a firm understanding of the cost structures involved, helped drive the processes for robust budgeting & transfer pricing. During challenge-meeting-sessions with budget holders helped ensure that Latest Estimates submissions were realistic and achievable. Produced MI reports, highlighting actual performance vs. budget with variance analysis for budget holders. For finance data, worked closely with the Finance Operation teams based at Shell Business Service Centre, Chennai, India.
Stakeholder Engagement
•	Worked closely with a wide range of senior managers, in providing all aspects of business support. With regular leadership meeting presentations & additional ad-hoc reporting, analysed Key Performance Indicators, to enhance the decision-making process for stakeholders. 
Controlling & Internal Controls
•	Month-End-Closing activities involved analysing Shell Corporate’s Profit/Loss & Balance Sheets and inputting explanations for variances in the SoAR reporting tool. Controlling/monitoring costs & revenue accruals, maintaining assessment cycles, posting into ledger accounts and conducting both Accounts Payable (coding & authorising payment of invoices) and Accounts Receivable activities (creating purchase and internal orders & issuing of invoices to recover costs incurred).
•	Quarterly Internal Control (SOx) activities involved maintaining Internal Audit Process Compliance documentation, staff role mapping, continuous verification on management approval limits, setting up vendors & creating/maintaining of cost centres for cost allocation and reporting purposes.
